New Records: Son Heung-min scored a brace, netting two goals for South Korea in the match.
Jung Seung-hyun scored the third goal for South Korea with a header from a corner kick.
South Korea achieved a 3-0 victory over China, securing six points at the top of Group C in the World Cup qualifiers.
Key Match Events: Son Heung-min scored an 11th-minute penalty after Hwang Hee-chan was brought down in the box.
Son Heung-min later scored a header from a corner kick just before half-time to extend South Korea's lead.
South Korea dominated the match, with numerous attempts on goal and a strong defensive performance.
Pre-Game Insights: Jurgen Klinsmann's side entered the match with confidence after a 5-0 victory over Singapore in their previous qualifying match.
The match was held at a sell-out crowd of over 40,000 in Shenzhen, China.
Post-Match Reflections: South Korea's manager Jurgen Klinsmann praised the team's performance and resilience in the match.
The victory strengthened South Korea's position in Group C and highlighted their strong qualifying campaign.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The match was followed by other Asian World Cup qualifiers, including North Korea's 6-1 win over Myanmar and Tajikistan's 3-3 draw with Pakistan.
